summary: Experienced Contract Manager with a demonstrated history of working in the construction industry. Skilled in AutoCAD, Design Management, Project Estimation, Feasibility Studies, and Constructability. Strong program and project management professional with a Post Bachelor Business Administration focused in Buisiness Administration from NCOI Opleidingsgroep.

certifications.name: CDM Regulations 2007
certifications.authority: Alfred McAlpine Health and Safety Solutions

projects.title: Wyre Forest Leisure Centre, Kidderminster (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
The attractive design of the new Wyre Forest Leisure Centre will inspire people to take part in a host of sports activities. Apart from a 25m competition pool with seating for spectators, visitors can use the learner pool, which will be provided with a moveable floor to accommodate different activities. The wet area will also offer a sauna & steamroom.

The 6 court sports hall is suitable for many different sports and because of its dividing wall, it can be used by several groups at the same time. Furthermore a fitness suite, cycling studio and two dance studios will be on offer as well as a seven meter high climbing wall and Kid’s Play area. Other areas include reception, café with seating area, offices, changing areas etc. Externally, six synthetic surface MUGA pitches, a 7-a-side pitch and five 5-a-side leisure pitches will be provided as well as parking space.

In a team with operator Places for People Leisure, Roberts Limbrick Architects and project managers Press & Starkey, Pellikaan will be responsible for the design and build construction of the new facilities. Having worked together on similar projects before, the team was able to work efficiently with the council to complete the PPP contract for the design, build, operation and maintenance of the centre in an exceptionally short period of time.

contributors.headline: Design Director at Pellikaan Construction Ltd
Divisional Director at Roberts Limbrick Architects
Architectural Technologist at Roberts Limbrick Ltd

projects.title: Tadworth Leisure & Community Centre and New Youth Centre (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
On the Banstead Athletic Football Club's training pitch, Pellikaan will design & build a new leisure and community centre and youth centre. Facilities in the new centre will include a training and a learner pool with viewing area, gym, studio, community room, crèche, café, sports hall and 4 five-a-side pitches. The youth centre will offer a training kitchen, computer area, one-to-one and group work rooms, youth worker office, activity hall, music facilities, a chill-out area, and an outdoor youth area.

The new centre is part of the regeneration of the Preston area.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.
Design Director at Pellikaan Construction Ltd

projects.title: Loampit Vale Leisure Centre, Lewisham (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
The Loampit Vale Leisure Centre will be situated on the lowest three
floors of a 27 storey apartment building in Lewisham.

The main facilities offered are a 25 meter competition pool with spectator
seating and a judgement platform and a 20 meter learner pool, both with
movable floors. On the first floor a gym and two dance studios are located
as well as a wellness area with treatment rooms, sauna and steam room.

Further areas include a club room, climbing wall, crèche, reception/café
area, meeting rooms and of course changing areas, offices etc.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.
Architectural Technican @ Architectus and Matchday Steward @ Brighton & Hove Albion FC

projects.title: Washington Leisure Centre, Washington (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
The replacement Washington Leisure Centre will offer a range of facilities including a six-lane 25m pool and a learner pool with two hydro slides, a four-court sports hall and sauna and steam rooms. In addition, there will be a soft play area and an additional multi purpose hall.

Outside there will be a 100 space car park and 5-a-side football pitches, as well as an attractive central hub that links the new facilities with the surrounding town centre. The new location and design of the centre means that it provides a very welcoming view, visually inviting the people in Washington to come in and enjoy the facilities.

The Leisure Centre replaces the older centre, which will remain open until the new centre is complete and open.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.
Regional Director  at Watson Batty Architects
Managing Director at Thornley & Lumb Partnership Ltd

projects.title: West Bromwich Leisure Centre, West Bromwich (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
DC Leisure was chosen to design, build, run and maintain the new West Bromwich Leisure Centre. Designed by Roberts Limbrick Architects, the centre will offer a 25m pool, learner pool, sauna and steam room, a four-court sports hall, fitness suite, dance studios, a dedicated children’s adventure area and a café.

As main contractor, Pellikaan was involved from the tender stage, working closely with DC Leisure and Roberts Limbrick to develop this high quality and feasible design and build sports complex.

Local involvement and regeneration are important factors for this project, stimulated by the enthusiasm and support of Sandwell Council. The centre will benefit Future Skills Sandwell students by providing training and employment opportunities, which already starts during construction: at least 10 local students will be involved in the construction process.

Collaboration with the council’s organisation “Think Local” enables Pellikaan to optimise local involvement during the process, also with regard to sourcing materials and subcontractors.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.
Divisional Director at Roberts Limbrick Architects
Former Senior Electrical Engineer at Brentwood Group (Part Time)

projects.title: Horley Leisure Centre, Horley (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
An old school building was demolished to accommodate the new public leisure centre in Horley. New facilities include a 25 meter pool together with a learner pool, four court multi-use sports hall, a 60 station fitness suite, studio and related changing and reception facilities. 155 parking spaces on the site, are shared with the adjoining Horley Town Football Club. The access road to the Football Club is within the site boundary and was kept open for the players and public throughout the project. 

The low carbon energy philosophy influenced design and engineering decisions: a biomass boiler, pool covers and solar panels were installed; and throughout the building, laminated timber beams and columns are used as well as cross laminated timber roof and wall panels. This resulted in several awards. 

During construction, Pellikaan cooperated closely with council and other local stakeholders about awareness and education regarding the project. The construction process, health & safety issues and related matters were taught on schools by Pellikaan staff, after which the school children toured the site at various times during construction. Pellikaan also supported local goals including the local eco art week and sponsorship of Horley Town FC.

contributors.headline: Principal Design Manager at John Sisk and Son Ltd
Director / Founder of Hadron Consulting Ltd

projects.title: Amrâth Hotel Hazeldonk, Breda (The Netherlands)
projects.description:
The Amrâth Hotel Hazeldonk, designed by ir W.Houdijk from Vlaardingen and build by Pellikaan, has 92 three star rooms, a bar/reception and breakfast room, where small snacks also can be served.

The hotel focusses ton the tourists and business users. Due to its location the border crossing between Belgium and The Netherlands it will attract many foreign visitors.

contributors.headline: Hoofduitvoerder bij Heerkens van Bavel Bouw BV

projects.title: Amrâth Hotel Maarsbergen, Maarsbergen (The Netherlands)
projects.description:
Amrâth Hotel Maarsbergen is one of the most centrally located hotels in the Netherlands. This four star property is located near Utrecht, next to the green area of the 'Utrechtse Heuvelrug'. Shopping cities like Amersfoort and Veenendaal are reachable within a 15 minute drive as well.

In the beautiful green surroundings of our hotel in Utrecht you can enjoy hiking and cycling. In the cities you will find beautiful churches, monasteries, castles, museums and historic villages. The very heart of Wijk bij Duurstede invites you to spend the afternoon shopping around. On sunny days, the entire family can swim at the Henschotermeer with white sandy beaches.

projects.title: David Lloyd Leisure Club, Exeter (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
David Lloyd Clubs and Next Generation Clubs have merged, making this project a unique build. This makes the interior architecture of upmost importance as this is the first club to reflect their common strategy. The site is adjacent to the local Rugby Club for the Exeter Chiefs and is near major traffic routes, making it easily accessible for all.

The facility comprises of a 25m 6 lane pool, children’s pool, outdoor pool, sauna, steam room and spa. With several kids’ activity rooms and a crèche this is truly the perfect family friendly centre for all ages. Additionally there is a tranquil Wellness Centre which houses a luxury sauna, spa, solarium and steam room, with access to the exceptional outdoor Sauna Garden, perfect for relaxing after a busy workout.

On the first floor, two of the three tennis courts are accommodated, along with a fitness centre, 2 dance studios, spinning room and treatment rooms.  

The use of the outdoor area should prove to be an instant hit with its outdoor pool, sauna garden, tennis court, 2 multipurpose courts for  tennis and five-a-side football and 2 kids play areas.

Along with all of the leisure facilities there are also a bar/restaurant, shop and hair salon, to unwind and socialise, and multi-functional meeting rooms for those looking for exclusive surroundings to conduct their business or hold private functions and events, making it a comprehensive centre.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.

projects.title: Christ Church Sports Centre, Canterbury (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
The Canterbury Christ Church University's new sports centre provides sports and recreation
facilities for the University and Barton Court Grammar School.

The centre features two full-sized netball/basketball courts within which there are provisions
for other sports including volleyball, badminton and cricket. There is a soundproof partition
in the middle of the sports hall so that it can be used simultaneously for different classes.
In addition, there are facilities for fitness, aerobics, changing, office and first aid.

A level difference of almost 5 meters on site greatly influenced the design of the centre,
which is a split level building. The Christ Church Sports Centre was tested with an air
tightness of 1.99: less then 20% of the leakage allowed by Building Regulations.

The University's new state-of-the-art sports centre received official status as a London 2012
Training Camp, with a world class sports and exercise science laboratory and student
accommodation which will be available to prospective nations wishing to compete in the
London 2012 Olympics.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.
Managing Director at Thornley & Lumb Partnership Ltd

projects.title: Hetton Communiy Pool and Welness Centre, Hetton-le-Hole (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
Sunderland City Council chose Pellikaan to build two 25m swimming pools based on design and cost: it was the most economically advantageous proposal.

Hetton Leisure Complex was demolished to make way for the Coalfields Swimming Pool. The new centre has a 5 lane 25-meter pool with viewing area, a learner pool, fitness, sauna area, reception and changing facilities. 

The existing centre stayed open until the new centre was handed over. Site location is next to the bus station, across the street from the library / council office and in front of the football fields where the Sunderland reserves play their matches on weeknights. 

Reuse demolition materials
Reuse of materials is generally encouraged at our projects and is mostly possible on projects which involve demolition works. In Hetton Le Hole, over 85% of the demolished building is re-used. The sports hall membrane roof was sold on to a farmer in Yorkshire. The roof joists were denailed and used as fence posts in Birmingham. All metal was weighed-in and re-cycled. Three trees that were felled were given to local residents for their wood burner stoves. 

Also, our waste carrier in Hetton-Le-Hole has a recycling rate of 85% for all waste materials and is investing in machinery that will increase this rate into +90%.

contributors.headline: Regional Director  at Watson Batty Architects

projects.title: Silksworth Community Pool, Tennis and Wellness Centre, Silksworth (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
Sunderland City Council chose Pellikaan to build two 25m swimming pools based on design and cost: it was the most economically advantageous proposal.

Sunderland South Swimming Pool was joined to the Sunderland Tennis Centre. The centre remained open during construction. A new 25 meter pool with various changing areas enhances the sports offer. Also, part of the existing centre was refurbished and a new shared entrance/reception area were realised, as well as a large outdoor adventure play area.

contributors.headline: Regional Director  at Watson Batty Architects

projects.title: Gosling Sports Park, Welwyn Garden City (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
A luxurious new spa and health club is the result of this redevelopment in Welwyn Garden
City, where Pellikaan also built the original centre nearly 20 years ago.
The former bowls hall was transformed and now offers a 17 metre spa pool with a swimming
lane, four water jet stations and fountains as well as six treatment rooms and four heat
therapy experiences: a Laconium, an Indian blossom steam room, Japanese salt room and
a Finnish sauna. Along with the 100 station gym, 3 exercise studios, spa and sports retails
units and refurbished entrance and café areas the new facilities are a fantastic upgrade for
the Sports Park.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.

projects.title: Watford Leisure Centre CENTRAL, Watford (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
In Watford, Pellikaan won a contract for two leisure centres at Central and Woodside.
At Central, the existing swimming pool in the town centre was demolished and replaced
by a new sports centre. The new centre encompasses a 6 lane 25 meter swimming pool as
well as a children’s pool, a sports hall, viewing areas, fitness area and exercise studio.
In addition, the centre has a great climbing wall, covering three storeys. The wall is an
important feature in the entrance and lobby areas. Other facilities include a crèche, café,
meeting rooms, offices and wet and dry changing facilities.

Sustainability was a key consideration in the design. It resulted in winning the International
Green Apple Award. The long term viability of the centre is increased through significant
renewable energy features, both in terms of a reduction in carbon emissions and in running
costs. Some examples are high insulation levels, a solar thermal array, rainwater recycling
and heat recovery systems to reclaim heat from air and water. The extended ground source
heat pump system, using boreholes of approx. 100 metres deep, enables use of the natural
heat of the earth. The system also re-uses excess heat generated by cooling. Furthermore,
heat loss and emission of carbon dioxide by air leakage were reduced significantly.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.

projects.title: Oostertuin, Tilburg (The Netherlands)
projects.description:
On a prominent location in Tilburg, at Ringbaan Oost, the new build development Oostertuin is realised in order for Tiwos.

After the demolition of 37 houses the development was realised: 88 properties and a parking basement. The project facilitates 59 flats and 29 family houses surrounding the plan.

In the centre of the properties, a courtyard is realised with parking facilities.

For the supply of energy the decision is made to use a sustainable system. For the heating of the properties a ground source heat pump system is used.

projects.title: EmpelZuid, Empel (The Netherlands)
projects.description:
In Empel a housing development of 84 houses is realised.

The feature of this project is the diversity in size,  audience, style and price range.

The development houses 59 properties for the private market and 25 properties to be let.

projects.title: Bulmershe Leisure Centre (Woodley, United Kingdom)
projects.description: The Bulmershe Leisure Centre includes a six-lane 25-metre swimming pool, a teaching pool with a movable floor, a gym plus a ‘live well’ gym, a four-court sports hall, and an additional studio and a café. It benefits the whole community with its up-to-date, accessible and flexible facilities, as well as preventative health services.

projects.title: Morden Leisure Centre (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
The attractive design of the new Morden Leisure Centre will inspire people to take part in a host of sports activities located on the edge of Morden Park.
Apart from a 25m competition pool with seating for spectators, visitors can use the learner / diving pool, which is provided with a moveable floor to accommodate different activities. The Learner / Diving pool also has 2no 1m spring boards and a precast concrete diving tower with a 3m and 5m platform.

Furthermore a fitness suite and dance studio / community room will be on offer. Other areas include reception, café with seating area, offices, changing areas etc.
 
In a team with client Merton Council , GT3 Architects and project managers Currie & Brown, Pellikaan will be responsible for the design and build construction of the new facilities.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.
Design Director at Pellikaan Construction Ltd

projects.title: Towers Health & Rackets Club (Club Towers) (United Kingdom)
projects.description:
The squash club closed, gym facilities moved toward the budget end of the market, a tennis club closed and there were no permanent indoor tennis courts around. Enough reason for Matthew Towers in Bedford to make a commitment to himself, that if he was ever in a position to improve the racquets and gym facilities in his town, he would make it happen.

Now, many years later, it happened: Bedford got a high-end health & racquets club with no less than 3 indoor and 4 outdoor tennis courts, 4 squash courts, a gym, high energy studio, mind & body studio and a state-of-the-art spin studio. The wet side of the centre will have a 20 meter pool, sauna, steam room, feature shower and hydropool. Further relaxation can be found upstairs in the wellness treatment rooms, or in the bar/café area, where you can find a quiet area as well as a dedicated kids club.

contributors.headline: Algemeen directeur bij Pellikaan Bouwbedrijf B.V.
Electrical Engineer at Elm Building Services Ltd

profile_positions.description:
Pellikaan specialises in non-housing projects; buildings used for commerce, recreation, and education. As an experienced and unique partner, we will work closely with you and your team and can provide a total package, or a combination of:
 
  • Design
 • Build 
 • Finance 
 • Maintain 
 • Operate 
 • Feasibility

Pellikaan is a stable and financially healthy family business. We operate locally and internationally in the Netherlands, Germany, England and Belgium. With around 180 employees Pellikaan has realised hundreds of schools, hotels, nurseries, offices, apartments, and other industrial buildings since 1947. We have also designed and built over 900 sports facilities including more than 500 swimming pools. These centres range from health clubs, racquet centres and wellness facilities to pools and sports halls.

50% of our turnover is generated on commercial projects for governments, developers, schools, and several multinational chains. The other 50% comes from sports construction. That makes Pellikaan a leading construction company in the European sports industry.

Operating experience 
You can benefit from our unique operating experience during all phases of your construction project. We implementthe best materials and the latest industry developments in traditional build projects, design & build projects and in PPP/PFI projects, using the feedback from 1.5 million visitors per year. Pellikaan operates successful multipurpose sports centres in the Netherlands: the leisure centres of Club Pellikaan.
profile_positions.title: Design / Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
One of my daily tasks during the project development was to get a housing development upto stage C and to determine the costings/budgets.
As a design manager I managed the build of a housing project containing a appartement building and four blocks of housing.
profile_positions.title: Project developer / Design Manager
